ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where died she?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's your pleasure, sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I must with haste from hence.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, then we kill all our women. We see how mortal an unkindness is to them; if they suffer our departure, death's the word.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I must be gone.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Under a compelling occasion, let women die. It were pity to cast them away for nothing, though between them and a great cause they should be esteemed nothing. Cleopatra, catching but the least noise of this, dies instantly; I have seen her die twenty times upon far poorer moment. I do think there is mettle in death, which commits some loving act upon her, she hath such a celerity in dying.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: She is cunning past man's thought.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Alack, sir, no! Her passions are made of nothing but the finest part of pure love. We cannot call her winds and waters sighs and tears; they are greater storms and tempests than almanacs can report. This cannot be cunning in her; if it be, she makes a show'r of rain as well as Jove.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would I had never seen her!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O Sir, you had then left unseen a wonderful piece of work, which not to have been blest withal would have discredited your travel.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fulvia is dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fulvia is dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fulvia?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, sir, give the gods a thankful sacrifice. When it pleaseth their deities to take the wife of a man from him, it shows to man the tailors of the earth; comforting therein that when old robes are worn out there are members to make new. If there were no more women but Fulvia, then had you indeed a cut, and the case to be lamented. This grief is crown'd with consolation: your old smock brings forth a new petticoat; and indeed the tears live in an onion that should water this sorrow.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And the business you have broach'd here cannot be without you; especially that of Cleopatra's, which wholly depends on your abode.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where is he?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I did not see him since.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What should I do I do not?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: In each thing give him way; cross him in nothing.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou teachest like a fool- the way to lose him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am sick and sullen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am sorry to give breathing to my purpose-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now, my dearest queen-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Pray you, stand farther from me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's the matter?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The gods best know-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Cleopatra-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Most sweet queen-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now, lady!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You'll heat my blood; no more.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You can do better yet; but this is meetly.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now, by my sword-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll leave you, lady.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here's more news.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis pity of him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Charmian!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, madam?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You think of him too much.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, 'tis treason!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam, I trust, not so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou, eunuch Mardian!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's your Highness' pleasure?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, gracious madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Indeed?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sovereign of Egypt, hail!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Mine ear must pluck it thence.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, was he sad or merry?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O that brave Caesar!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The valiant Caesar!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where have you this? 'Tis false.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: From Silvius, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But small to greater matters must give way.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Not if the small come first.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I do not know, Maecenas. Ask Agrippa.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Welcome to Rome.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thank you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sit.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sit, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, then.                                  [They sit]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How intend you- practis'd?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would we had all such wives, that the men might go to wars with the women!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Soft, Caesar!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis noble spoken.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Worthily spoken, Maecenas.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou art a soldier only. Speak no more.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That truth should be silent I had almost forgot.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You wrong this presence; therefore speak no more.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Go to, then- your considerate stone!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Give me leave, Caesar.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Speak, Agrippa.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will Caesar speak?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Happily, amen!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where lies he?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: About the Mount Misenum.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What is his strength by land?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Welcome from Egypt, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Half the heart of Caesar, worthy Maecenas! My honourable friend, Agrippa!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good Enobarbus!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We have cause to be glad that matters are so well digested. You stay'd well by't in Egypt.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, sir; we did sleep day out of countenance and made the night light with drinking.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Eight wild boars roasted whole at a breakfast, and but twelve persons there. Is this true?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: This was but as a fly by an eagle. We had much more monstrous matter of feast, which worthily deserved noting.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: She's a most triumphant lady, if report be square to her.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: When she first met Mark Antony she purs'd up his heart, upon the river of Cydnus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: There she appear'd indeed! Or my reporter devis'd well for her.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, rare for Antony!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Rare Egyptian!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now Antony must leave her utterly.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good night, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now, sirrah, you do wish yourself in Egypt?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would I had never come from thence, nor you thither!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If you can- your reason.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I see it in my motion, have it not in my tongue; but yet hie you to Egypt again.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Speak this no more.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, good success!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let it alone! Let's to billiards. Come, Charmian.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My arm is sore; best play with Mardian.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: As well as I can, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam, madam-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: First, madam, he is well.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good madam, hear me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will't please you hear me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam, he's well.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well said.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And friends with Caesar.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Th'art an honest man.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar and he are greater friends than ever.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Make thee a fortune from me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But yet, madam-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: For what good turn?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: For the best turn i' th' bed.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am pale, Charmian.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam, he's married to Octavia.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good madam, patience.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He's married, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Rogue, thou hast liv'd too long.    [Draws a knife]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He is afear'd to come.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have done my duty.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He's married, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The gods confound thee! Dost thou hold there still?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Should I lie, madam?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I crave your Highness' pardon.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He is married?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good your Highness, patience.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: In praising Antony I have disprais'd Caesar.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Many times, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Take your time.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: There's the point.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That's our offer.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well met here.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That's the next to do.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That will I, Pompey.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You have heard much.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have fair meanings, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And fair words to them.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No more of that! He did so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, I pray you?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A certain queen to Caesar in a mattress.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I know thee now. How far'st thou, soldier?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Show's the way, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come.               Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS and MENAS

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] Thy father, Pompey, would ne'er have made this treaty.- You and I have known, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: At sea, I think.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We have, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You have done well by water.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And you by land.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I Will praise any man that will praise me; though it cannot be denied what I have done by land.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nor what I have done by water.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, something you can deny for your own safety: you have been a great thief by sea.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And you by land.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: All men's faces are true, whatsome'er their hands are.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But there is never a fair woman has a true face.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No slander: they steal hearts.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We came hither to fight with you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If he do, sure he cannot weep't back again.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Y'have said, sir. We look'd not for Mark Antony here. Pray you, is he married to Cleopatra?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar' sister is call'd Octavia.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: True, sir; she was the wife of Caius Marcellus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But she is now the wife of Marcus Antonius.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Pray ye, sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis true.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Then is Caesar and he for ever knit together.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If I were bound to divine of this unity, I would not prophesy so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I think the policy of that purpose made more in the marriage than the love of the parties.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I think so too. But you shall find the band that seems to tie their friendship together will be the very strangler of their amity: Octavia is of a holy, cold, and still conversation.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who would not have his wife so?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Not he that himself is not so; which is Mark Antony. He will to his Egyptian dish again; then shall the sighs of Octavia blow the fire up in Caesar, and, as I said before, that which is the strength of their amity shall prove the immediate author of their variance. Antony will use his affection where it is; he married but his occasion here.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And thus it may be. Come, sir, will you aboard? I have a health for you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I shall take it, sir. We have us'd our throats in Egypt.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here they'll be, man. Some o' their plants are ill-rooted already; the least wind i' th' world will blow them down.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Lepidus is high-colour'd.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: They have made him drink alms-drink.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: As they pinch one another by the disposition, he cries out 'No more!'; reconciles them to his entreaty and himself to th' drink.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But it raises the greater war between him and his discretion.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, this it is to have a name in great men's fellowship. I had as lief have a reed that will do me no service as a partizan I could not heave.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Y'have strange serpents there.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, Lepidus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Your serpent of Egypt is bred now of your mud by the operation of your sun; so is your crocodile.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: They are so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sit- and some wine! A health to Lepidus!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am not so well as I should be, but I'll ne'er out.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Not till you have slept. I fear me you'll be in till then.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, certainly, I have heard the Ptolemies' pyramises are very goodly things. Without contradiction I have heard that.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to POMPEY] Pompey, a word.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to MENAS] Say in mine ear; what is't?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What manner o' thing is your crocodile?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is shap'd, sir, like itself, and it is as broad as it hath breadth; it is just so high as it is, and moves with it own organs. It lives by that which nourisheth it, and the elements once out of it, it transmigrates.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What colour is it of?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Of it own colour too.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis a strange serpent.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis so. And the tears of it are wet.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will this description satisfy him?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: With the health that Pompey gives him, else he is a very epicure.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to MENAS] I think th'art mad. [Rises and walks aside] The matter?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have ever held my cap off to thy fortunes.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Wilt thou be lord of all the world?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What say'st thou?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Wilt thou be lord of the whole world? That's twice.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How should that be?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hast thou drunk well?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Show me which way.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: This health to Lepidus!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Bear him ashore. I'll pledge it for him, Pompey.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here's to thee, Menas!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Enobarbus, welcome!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fill till the cup be hid.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'A bears the third part of the world, man; see'st not?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Drink thou; increase the reels.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: This is not yet an Alexandrian feast.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Be a child o' th' time.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let's ha't, good soldier.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll try you on the shore.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And shall, sir. Give's your hand.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hoo! says 'a. There's my cap.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where is he now?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, are the brothers parted?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis a noble Lepidus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A very fine one. O, how he loves Caesar!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, but how dearly he adores Mark Antony!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar? Why he's the Jupiter of men.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's Antony? The god of Jupiter.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Spake you of Caesar? How! the nonpareil!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, Antony! O thou Arabian bird!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would you praise Caesar, say 'Caesar'- go no further.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Indeed, he plied them both with excellent praises.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Both he loves.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No further, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have said.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My noble brother!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, look well to my husband's house; and-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, Octavia?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll tell you in your ear.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to AGRIPPA] Will Caesar weep?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to ENOBARBUS] He has a cloud in's face.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Adieu; be happy!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Farewell, farewell!                   [Kisses OCTAVIA]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where is the fellow?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Half afeard to come.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Most gracious Majesty!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Didst thou behold Octavia?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, dread Queen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is she as tall as me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: She is not, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Didst hear her speak? Is she shrill-tongu'd or low?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam, I heard her speak: she is low-voic'd.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That's not so good. He cannot like her long.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Like her? O Isis! 'tis impossible.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is this certain?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Or I have no observance.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Excellent.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Guess at her years, I prithee.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Widow? Charmian, hark!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And I do think she's thirty.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Bear'st thou her face in mind? Is't long or round?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Round even to faultiness.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A proper man.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nothing, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now, friend Eros!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: There's strange news come, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, man?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar and Lepidus have made wars upon Pompey.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: This is old. What is the success?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Our great navy's rigg'd.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: This in the public eye?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who does he accuse?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, this should be answer'd.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He'll never yield to that.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hail, Caesar, and my lord! hail, most dear Caesar!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That ever I should call thee cast-away!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You have not call'd me so, nor have you cause.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Do not say so, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord, in Athens.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Welcome, lady.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is it so, sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I will be even with thee, doubt it not.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But why, why,

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well, is it, is it?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What is't you say?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: By sea! What else?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why will my lord do so?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: For that he dares us to't.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So hath my lord dar'd him to single fight.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: By sea, by sea.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll fight at sea.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have sixty sails, Caesar none better.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: By Hercules, I think I am i' th' right.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who's his lieutenant, hear you?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: They say one Taurus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The Emperor calls Canidius.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Taurus!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's thy passion?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How appears the fight?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Toward Peloponnesus are they fled.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fly? Not we!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, gentle madam, to him! Comfort him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Do, most dear Queen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Do? Why, what else?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let me sit down. O Juno!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, no, no, no, no.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: See you here, sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, fie, fie, fie!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam, O good Empress!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, sir!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ah, stand by!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The Queen, my lord, the Queen!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, the Queen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, my pardon!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Pardon, pardon!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Approach, and speak.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Be't so. Declare thine office.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fortune pursue thee!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar, I go.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What shall we do, Enobarbus?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Think, and die.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is Antony or we in fault for this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is that his answer?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He says so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That head, my lord?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A messenger from Caesar.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar's will?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hear it apart.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: None but friends: say boldly.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So, haply, are they friends to Antony.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Go on. Right royal!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's your name?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My name is Thyreus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] You will be whipt.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Mark Antony-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good my lord-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, is't come to this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Wherefore is this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Soundly, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Cried he? and begg'd 'a pardon?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He did ask favour.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Have you done yet?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I must stay his time.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Not know me yet?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Cold-hearted toward me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That's my brave lord!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We will yet do well.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Call all his noble captains to my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He will not fight with me, Domitius?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why should he not?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll strike, and cry 'Take all.'

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to ENOBARBUS] What means this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The gods forbid!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Brother, good night. To-morrow is the day.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nothing. What news?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Belike 'tis but a rumour. Good night to you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Soldiers, have careful watch.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Peace, what noise?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: List, list!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hark!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Music i' th' air.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Under the earth.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It signs well, does it not?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now, masters!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay; is't not strange?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Do you hear, masters? Do you hear?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Eros! mine armour, Eros!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sleep a little.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sooth, la, I'll help. Thus it must be.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Briefly, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is not this buckled well?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The morn is fair. Good morrow, General.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good morrow, General.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Please you retire to your chamber?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The gods make this a happy day to Antony!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who's gone this morning?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What say'st thou?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is he gone?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Most certain.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar, I shall.                                 Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I give it you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou bleed'st apace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: They do retire.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, bear me witness, night-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What man is this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Stand close and list him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Enobarbus?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let's speak to him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let's do so. But he sleeps.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Go we to him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Awake, sir, awake; speak to us.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hear you, sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: For both, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why is my lord enrag'd against his love?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Eros, thou yet behold'st me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, noble lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It does, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dead then?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What would my lord?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I would not see't.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, sir, pardon me!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Lo thee!                            [Turning from him]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My sword is drawn.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis said, man; and farewell.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Farewell, great chief. Shall I strike now?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now, Eros.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's the noise?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The star is fall'n.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And time is at his period.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Alas, and woe!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let him that loves me, strike me dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Not I.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nor I.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nor any one.                         Exeunt guard

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where's Antony?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: There, Diomed, there.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: When did she send thee?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where is she?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Too late, good Diomed. Call my guard, I prithee.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Most heavy day!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O Charmian, I will never go from hence!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Be comforted, dear madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, quick, or I am gone.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A heavy sight!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: They do not go together.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, quietness, lady!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: She's dead too, our sovereign.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Lady!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Madam!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O madam, madam, madam!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Royal Egypt, Empress!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Peace, peace, Iras!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What is't thou say'st?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I say, O Caesar, Antony is dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So the gods preserve thee!                      Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Caesar, I shall.                              Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dolabella!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's thy name?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My name is Proculeius.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Royal Queen!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O Cleopatra! thou art taken, Queen!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Quick, quick, good hands.        [Drawing a dagger]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, temperance, lady!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Most noble Empress, you have heard of me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I cannot tell.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Assuredly you know me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I understand not, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If it might please ye-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Most sovereign creature-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Cleopatra-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Gentle madam, no.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am loath to tell you what I would you knew.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, pray you, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Though he be honourable-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He'll lead me, then, in triumph?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Which is the Queen of Egypt?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is the Emperor, madam.        [CLEOPATPA kneels]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You shall advise me in all for Cleopatra.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here, madam.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What have I kept back?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Enough to purchase what you have made known.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good Queen, let us entreat you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Forbear, Seleucus.                       Exit SELEUCUS

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My master and my lord!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where's the Queen?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Behold, sir.                                    Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dolabella!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The gods forbid!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O the good gods!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, that's certain.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: This is the man.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Truly, I have him. But I would not be the party that should desire you to touch him, for his biting is immortal; those that do die of it do seldom or never recover.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Remember'st thou any that have died on't?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Very many, men and women too. I heard of one of them no longer than yesterday: a very honest woman, but something given to lie, as a woman should not do but in the way of honesty; how she died of the biting of it, what pain she felt- truly she makes a very good report o' th' worm. But he that will believe all that they say shall never be saved by half that they do. But this is most falliable, the worm's an odd worm.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Get thee hence; farewell.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Farewell.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You must think this, look you, that the worm will do his kind.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, ay; farewell.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Look you, the worm is not to be trusted but in the keeping of wise people; for indeed there is no goodness in the worm.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Take thou no care; it shall be heeded.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Very good. Give it nothing, I pray you, for it is not worth the feeding.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will it eat me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You must not think I am so simple but I know the devil himself will not eat a woman. I know that a woman is a dish for the gods, if the devil dress her not. But truly, these same whoreson devils do the gods great harm in their women, for in every ten that they make the devils mar five.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well, get thee gone; farewell.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O Eastern star!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, break! O, break!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where's the Queen?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Speak softly, wake her not.

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Approach, ho! All's not well: Caesar's beguil'd.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE TRAGEDY OF ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: There's Dolabella sent from Caesar; call him.

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What work is here! Charmian, is this well done?

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How goes it here?

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: All dead.

Yonder comes my master, your brother.
Go apart, Adam, and thou shalt hear how he will shake me up.                                           [ADAM retires]
Now, sir! what make you here?
Nothing; I am not taught to make any thing.
What mar you then, sir?
Marry, sir, I am helping you to mar that which God made, a poor unworthy brother of yours, with idleness.
Marry, sir, be better employed, and be nought awhile.
Shall I keep your hogs, and eat husks with them? What prodigal portion have I spent that I should come to such penury?
Know you where you are, sir?
O, sir, very well; here in your orchard.
Know you before whom, sir?

Ay, better than him I am before knows me. I know you are my eldest brother; and in the gentle condition of blood, you should so know me. The courtesy of nations allows you my better in that you are the first-born; but the same tradition takes not away my blood, were there twenty brothers betwixt us. I have as much of my father in me as you, albeit I confess your coming before me is nearer to his reverence.
What, boy!                               [Strikes him]
Come, come, elder brother, you are too young in this.
Wilt thou lay hands on me, villain?
[Coming forward] Sweet masters, be patient; for your father's remembrance, be at accord.
Let me go, I say.

I will not, till I please; you shall hear me. My father charg'd you in his will to give me good education: you have train'd me like a peasant, obscuring and hiding from me all gentleman-like qualities. The spirit of my father grows strong in me, and I will no longer endure it; therefore allow me such exercises as may become a gentleman, or give me the poor allottery my father left me by testament; with that I will go buy my fortunes.
And what wilt thou do? Beg, when that is spent? Well, sir, get you in. I will not long be troubled with you; you shall have some part of your will. I pray you leave me.
I no further offend you than becomes me for my good.
Get you with him, you old dog.
Calls your worship?
not Charles, the Duke's wrestler, here to speak with me?
So please you, he is here at the door and importunes access to you.
Good morrow to your worship.
Good Monsieur Charles! What's the new news at the new court?

There's no news at the court, sir, but the old news; that is, the old Duke is banished by his younger brother the new Duke; and three or four loving lords have put themselves into voluntary exile with him, whose lands and revenues enrich the new Duke; therefore he gives them good leave to wander.
Can you tell if Rosalind, the Duke's daughter, be banished with her father?

O, no; for the Duke's daughter, her cousin, so loves her, being ever from their cradles bred together, that she would have followed her exile, or have died to stay behind her. She is at the court, and no less beloved of her uncle than his own daughter; and never two ladies loved as they do.
Where will the old Duke live?

They say he is already in the Forest of Arden, and a many merry men with him; and there they live like the old Robin Hood of England. They say many young gentlemen flock to him every day, and fleet the time carelessly, as they did in the golden world.
What, you wrestle to-morrow before the new Duke?
I pray thee, Rosalind, sweet my coz, be merry.

Dear Celia, I show more mirth than I am mistress of; and would you yet I were merrier? Unless you could teach me to forget a banished father, you must not learn me how to remember any extraordinary pleasure.

Herein I see thou lov'st me not with the full weight that I love thee. If my uncle, thy banished father, had banished thy uncle, the Duke my father, so thou hadst been still with me, I could have taught my love to take thy father for mine; so wouldst thou, if the truth of thy love to me were so righteously temper'd as mine is to thee.
Well, I will forget the condition of my estate, to rejoice in yours.
Marry, I prithee, do, to make sport withal; but love no man in good earnest, nor no further in sport neither than with safety of a pure blush thou mayst in honour come off again.
What shall be our sport, then?
Let us sit and mock the good housewife Fortune from her wheel, that her gifts may henceforth be bestowed equally.
I would we could do so; for her benefits are mightily misplaced; and the bountiful blind woman doth most mistake in her gifts to women.
'Tis true; for those that she makes fair she scarce makes honest; and those that she makes honest she makes very ill-favouredly.
Mistress, you must come away to your father.
Were you made the messenger?
No, by mine honour; but I was bid to come for you.
Where learned you that oath, fool?
How prove you that, in the great heap of your knowledge?
Ay, marry, now unmuzzle your wisdom.
Stand you both forth now: stroke your chins, and swear by your beards that I am a knave.
By our beards, if we had them, thou art.

By my knavery, if I had it, then I were. But if you swear by that that not, you are not forsworn; no more was this knight, swearing by his honour, for he never had any; or if he had, he had sworn it away before ever he saw those pancackes or that mustard.
Prithee, who is't that thou mean'st?
One that old Frederick, your father, loves.
My father's love is enough to honour him. Enough, speak no more of him; you'll be whipt for taxation one of these days.
The more pity that fools may not speak wisely what wise men do foolishly.
With his mouth full of news.
Which he will put on us as pigeons feed their young.
Then shall we be news-cramm'd.
As wit and fortune will.
Or as the Destinies decrees.
Well said; that was laid on with a trowel.
Nay, if I keep not my rank-
Alas!
Thus men may grow wiser every day. It is the first time that ever I heard breaking of ribs was sport for ladies.
Or I, I promise thee.
Come on; since the youth will not be entreated, his own peril on his forwardness.
Alas, he is too young; yet he looks successfully.
How now, daughter and cousin! Are you crept hither to see the wrestling?
Ay, my liege; so please you give us leave.
Call him hither, good Monsieur Le Beau.
I attend them with all respect and duty.
Young man, have you challeng'd Charles the wrestler?
No, fair Princess; he is the general challenger. I come but in, as others do, to try with him the strength of my youth.
Do, young sir; your reputation shall not therefore be misprised: we will make it our suit to the Duke that the wrestling might not go forward.
The little strength that I have, I would it were with you.
And mine to eke out hers.
Fare you well. Pray heaven I be deceiv'd in you!
Your heart's desires be with you!
Come, where is this young gallant that is so desirous to lie with his mother earth?
Ready, sir; but his will hath in it a more modest working.
You shall try but one fall.
No, I warrant your Grace, you shall not entreat him to a second, that have so mightily persuaded him from a first.
You mean to mock me after; you should not have mock'd me before; but come your ways.
Now, Hercules be thy speed, young man!
I would I were invisible, to catch the strong fellow by the leg.                                          [They wrestle]
O excellent young man!
No more, no more.
Yes, I beseech your Grace; I am not yet well breath'd.
Bear him away. What is thy name, young man?
Were I my father, coz, would I do this?
Ay. Fare you well, fair gentleman.
Will you go, coz?
Not one to throw at a dog.
No, thy words are too precious to be cast away upon curs; throw some of them at me; come, lame me with reasons.
Then there were two cousins laid up, when the one should be lam'd with reasons and the other mad without any.
But is all this for your father?
No, some of it is for my child's father. O, how full of briers is this working-day world!
They are but burs, cousin, thrown upon thee in holiday foolery; if we walk not in the trodden paths, our very petticoats will catch them.
I could shake them off my coat: these burs are in my heart.
Hem them away.
I would try, if I could cry 'hem' and have him.
Come, come, wrestle with thy affections.
O, they take the part of a better wrestler than myself.

O, a good wish upon you! You will try in time, in despite of a fall. But, turning these jests out of service, let us talk in good earnest. Is it possible, on such a sudden, you should fall into so strong a liking with old Sir Rowland's youngest son?
The Duke my father lov'd his father dearly.
No, faith, hate him not, for my sake.
Let me love him for that; and do you love him because I do. Look, here comes the Duke.
With his eyes full of anger.
Me, uncle?
Thou art thy father's daughter; there's enough.
Dear sovereign, hear me speak.
I have more cause.
That he hath not.
Why, whither shall we go?
To seek my uncle in the Forest of Arden.
What shall I call thee when thou art a man?
And did you leave him in this contemplation?
Who's there?
Why, what's the matter?
Why, whither, Adam, wouldst thou have me go?
No matter whither, so you come not here.
O Jupiter, how weary are my spirits!
I Care not for my spirits, if my legs were not weary.

I could find in my heart to disgrace my man's apparel, and to cry like a woman; but I must comfort the weaker vessel, as doublet and hose ought to show itself courageous to petticoat; therefore, courage, good Aliena.
I pray you bear with me; I cannot go no further.
For my part, I had rather bear with you than bear you; yet I should bear no cross if I did bear you; for I think you have no money in your purse.
Well,. this is the Forest of Arden.
Ay, be so, good Touchstone. Look you, who comes here, a young man and an old in solemn talk.
That is the way to make her scorn you still.
O Corin, that thou knew'st how I do love her!
I partly guess; for I have lov'd ere now.
Into a thousand that I have forgotten.
Thou speak'st wiser than thou art ware of.
Nay, I shall ne'er be ware of mine own wit till I break my shins against it.
And mine; but it grows something stale with me.
Holla, you clown!
