In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: In your behalf still will I wear the same.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And so will I.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord, your loving nephew now is come.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Richard Plantagenet, my friend, is he come?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Of Which, my lord, your honour is the last.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Am I not Protector, saucy priest?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And am not I a prelate of the church?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Unreverent Gloucester!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Rome shall remedy this.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Roam thither then.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord, it were your duty to forbear.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, see the bishop be not overborne.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, when his holy state is touch'd so near.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, if we be forbidden stones, we'll fall to it with our teeth.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He shall submit, or I will never yield.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here, Winchester, I offer thee my hand.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
COUNTESS: WINCHESTER  [Aside]  So help me God, as I intend it not
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: WINCHESTER  [Aside]  So help me God, as I intend it not!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Content: I'll to the surgeon's.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And so will I.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And I will see what physic the tavern affords.                         Exeunt servants, MAYOR, &C.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: As will the rest, so willeth Winchester.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Welcome, high Prince, the mighty Duke of York!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Within]  Qui est la?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Enter, go in; the market-bell is rung.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Your Grace may starve, perhaps, before that time.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, let no words, but deeds, revenge this treason!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dare ye come forth and meet us in the field?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Signior, no.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My vows are equal partners with thy vows.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Courageous Bedford, let us now persuade you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Whither away, Sir John Fastolfe, in such haste?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What! Will you and leave Lord Talbot?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What Lord Talbot pleaseth Burgundy.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A parley with the Duke of Burgundy!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who craves a parley with the Burgundy?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The princely Charles of France, thy countryman.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What say'st thou, Charles? for I am marching hence.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Speak, Pucelle, and enchant him with thy words.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Speak on; but be not over-tedious.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Done like a Frenchman-  [Aside]  turn and turn again.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Welcome, brave Duke! Thy friendship makes us fresh.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And doth beget new courage in our breasts.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, if it please your Majesty, my liege.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sirrah, thy lord I honour as he is.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, what is he? As good a man as York!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Lord Bishop, set the crown upon his head.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: God save King Henry, of that name the Sixth!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What! Doth my uncle Burgundy revolt?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He doth, my lord, and is become your foe.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is that the worst this letter doth contain?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is the worst, and all, my lord, he writes.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Grant me the combat, gracious sovereign.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And me, my lord, grant me the combat too.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: This is my servant: hear him, noble Prince.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And this is mine: sweet Henry, favour him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: With him, my lord; for he hath done me wrong.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And I with him; for he hath done me wrong.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What is that wrong whereof you both complain? First let me know, and then I'll answer you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will not this malice, Somerset, be left?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: There is my pledge; accept it, Somerset.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, let it rest where it began at first.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Confirm it so, mine honourable lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It grieves his Highness. Good my lords, be friends.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, send some succour to the distress'd lord!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now, Sir William! Whither were you sent?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: York set him on; York should have sent him aid.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If he be dead, brave Talbot, then, adieu!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fly to revenge my death, if I be slain.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He that flies so will ne'er return again.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If we both stay, we both are sure to die.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Shall all thy mother's hopes lie in one tomb?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, rather than I'll shame my mother's womb.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Upon my blessing I command thee go.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: To fight I will, but not to fly the foe.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Part of thy father may be sav'd in thee.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No part of him but will be shame in me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou never hadst renown, nor canst not lose it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, your renowned name; shall flight abuse it?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thy father's charge shall clear thee from that stain.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O my dear lord, lo where your son is borne!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: On what submissive message art thou sent?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Go, take their bodies hence.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How doth your Grace affect their motion?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I will attend upon your lordship's leisure.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What tidings send our scouts? I prithee speak.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Chang'd to a worser shape thou canst not be.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fell banning hag; enchantress, hold thy tongue.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I prithee give me leave to curse awhile.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why speak'st thou not? What ransom must I pay?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Wilt thou accept of ransom-yea or no?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I were best leave him, for he will not hear.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside]  There all is marr'd; there lies a cooling card.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He talks at random; sure, the man is mad.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside]  And yet a dispensation may be had.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And yet I would that you would answer me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He talks of wood. It is some carpenter.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hear ye, Captain-are you not at leisure?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Lady, vouchsafe to listen what I say.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sweet madam, give me hearing in a cause

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside]  Tush! women have been captivate ere now.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Lady, wherefore talk you so?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I cry you mercy, 'tis but quid for quo.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, what concerns his freedom unto me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: His love.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am unworthy to be Henry's wife.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: An if my father please, I am content.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: To whom?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: To me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Speaks Suffolk as he thinks?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And this withal.                         [Kisses her]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Graceless, wilt thou deny thy parentage?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, ay. Away with her to execution!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now heaven forfend! The holy maid with child!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A married man! That's most intolerable.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It's sign she hath been liberal and free.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE FIRST PART OF HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How say'st thou, Charles? Shall our condition stand?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Kneeling] Long live Queen Margaret, England's happiness!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We thank you all.                            [Flourish]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Uncle, how now!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Uncle of Winchester, I pray read on.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And so says York- [Aside] for he hath greatest cause.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Then let's make haste away and look unto the main.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I go. Come, Nell, thou wilt ride with us?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Jesus preserve your royal Majesty!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What say'st thou? Majesty! I am but Grace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My masters, let's stand close; my Lord Protector will come this way by and by, and then we may deliver our supplications in the quill.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come back, fool; this is the Duke of Suffolk and not my Lord Protector.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now, fellow! Wouldst anything with me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Reads] 'To my Lord Protector!' Are your supplications to his lordship? Let me see them. What is thine?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Alas, sir, I am but a poor petitioner of our whole township.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Presenting his petition] Against my master, Thomas Horner, for saying that the Duke of York was rightful heir to the crown.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What say'st thou? Did the Duke of York say he was rightful heir to the crown?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That my master was? No, forsooth. My master said that he was, and that the King was an usurper.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come, let's be gone.                               Exeunt

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ambitious Warwick, let thy betters speak.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The Cardinal's not my better in the field.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: All in this presence are thy betters, Warwick.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Warwick may live to be the best of all.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Because the King, forsooth, will have it so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sweet aunt, be quiet; 'twas against her will.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Peace, headstrong Warwick!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Doth any one accuse York for a traitor?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What mean'st thou, Suffolk? Tell me, what are these?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Say, man, were these thy words?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: An't shall please your Majesty, I never said nor thought any such matter. God is my witness, I am falsely accus'd by the villain.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Uncle, what shall we say to this in law?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I humbly thank your royal Majesty.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And I accept the combat willingly.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sirrah, or you must fight or else be hang'd.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come, my masters; the Duchess, I tell you, expects performance of your promises.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Master Hume, we are therefore provided; will her ladyship behold and hear our exorcisms?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, what else? Fear you not her courage.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well said, my masters; and welcome all. To this gear, the sooner the better.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Adsum.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ask what thou wilt; that I had said and done.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Reads] 'First of the king: what shall of him become?'

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'What fates await the Duke of Suffolk?'

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: By water shall he die and take his end.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'What shall befall the Duke of Somerset?'

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I thought as much; he would be above the clouds.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The treasury of everlasting joy!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: As who, my lord?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, Suffolk, England knows thine insolence.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And thy ambition, Gloucester.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to CARDINAL] Faith, holy uncle, would 'twere come to that!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to GLOUCESTER] Marry, when thou dar'st.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now, my lords!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: True, uncle.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to GLOUCESTER] Are ye advis'd? The east side of the grove?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside to CARDINAL] Cardinal, I am with you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, how now, uncle Gloucester!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A miracle! A miracle!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come to the King, and tell him what miracle.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Born blind, an't please your Grace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay indeed was he.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What woman is this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: His wife, an't like your worship.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hadst thou been his mother, thou couldst have better told.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where wert thou born?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: At Berwick in the north, an't like your Grace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, art thou lame?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, God Almighty help me!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How cam'st thou so?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A fall off of a tree.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A plum tree, master.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How long hast thou been blind?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, born so, master!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, and wouldst climb a tree?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But that in all my life, when I was a youth.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Too true; and bought his climbing very dear.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Mass, thou lov'dst plums well, that wouldst venture so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, master, clear as day, I thank God and Saint Alban.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Say'st thou me so? What colour is this cloak of?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Red, master; red as blood.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, that's well said. What colour is my gown of?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Black, forsooth; coal-black as jet.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, then, thou know'st what colour jet is of?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And yet, I think, jet did he never see.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But cloaks and gowns before this day a many.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Never before this day in all his life.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Tell me, sirrah, what's my name?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Alas, master, I know not.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's his name?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I know not.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nor his?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, indeed, master.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's thine own name?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Saunder Simpcox, an if it please you, master.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O master, that you could!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My masters of Saint Albans, have you not beadles in your town, and things call'd whips?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, my lord, if it please your Grace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Then send for one presently.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now fetch me a stool hither by and by. [A stool brought] Now, sirrah, if you mean to save yourself from whipping, leap me over this stool and run away.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I will, my lord. Come on, sirrah; off with your doublet quickly.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O God, seest Thou this, and bearest so long?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It made me laugh to see the villain run.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Follow the knave, and take this drab away.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Alas, sir, we did it for pure need!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Duke Humphrey has done a miracle to-day.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: True; made the lame to leap and fly away.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What tidings with our cousin Buckingham?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord, I long to hear it at full.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But William of Hatfield died without an heir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Long live our sovereign Richard, England's King!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord, break we off; we know your mind at full.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Welcome is banishment; welcome were my death.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here, neighbour Horner, I drink to you in a cup of sack; and fear not, neighbour, you shall do well enough.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And here, neighbour, here's a cup of charneco.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And here's a pot of good double beer, neighbour; drink, and fear not your man.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let it come, i' faith, and I'll pledge you all; and a fig for Peter!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here, Peter, I drink to thee; and be not afraid.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Be merry, Peter, and fear not thy master: fight for credit of the prentices.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I thank you all. Drink, and pray for me, I pray you; for I think I have taken my last draught in this world. Here, Robin, an if I die, I give thee my apron; and, Will, thou shalt have my hammer; and here, Tom, take all the money that I have. O Lord bless me, I pray God! for I am never able to deal with my master, he hath learnt so much fence already.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Peter, forsooth.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Peter? What more?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thump.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thump? Then see thou thump thy master well.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Masters, I am come hither, as it were, upon my man's instigation, to prove him a knave and myself an honest man; and touching the Duke of York, I will take my death I never meant him any ill, nor the King, nor the Queen; and therefore, Peter, have at thee with a down right blow!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Take away his weapon. Fellow, thank God, and the good wine in thy master's way.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ten, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So please your Grace, we'll take her from the sheriff.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, stir not for your lives; let her pass by.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Be patient, gentle Nell; forget this grief.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Must you, Sir John, protect my lady here?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So am I given in charge, may't please your Grace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, gone, my lord, and bid me not farewell!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is my office; and, madam, pardon me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: All health unto my gracious sovereign!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Welcome, Lord Somerset. What news from France?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Cold news, Lord Somerset; but God's will be done!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It serves you well, my lord, to say so much.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I say no more than truth, so help me God!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But I can give the loser leave to chide.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sirs, take away the Duke, and guard him sure.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, will your Highness leave the Parliament?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So that, by this, you would not have him die.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ah, York, no man alive so fain as I!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So the poor chicken should be sure of death.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thrice-noble Suffolk, 'tis resolutely spoke.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here is my hand the deed is worthy doing.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And so say I.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, worse than nought? Nay, then a shame take all!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And in the number, thee that wishest shame!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I will, my lord, so please his Majesty.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here comes my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now, sirs, have you dispatch'd this thing?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, my good lord, he's dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis, my good lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll call him presently, my noble lord.          Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dead in his bed, my lord; Gloucester is dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Marry, God forfend!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How fares my lord? Help, lords! The King is dead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Rear up his body; wring him by the nose.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Run, go, help, help! O Henry, ope thine eyes!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He doth revive again; madam, be patient.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O heavenly God!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How fares my gracious lord?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Comfort, my sovereign! Gracious Henry, comfort!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ah, woe is me for Gloucester, wretched man!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come hither, gracious sovereign, view this body.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What dares not Warwick, if false Suffolk dare him?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Within] An answer from the King, my Lord of Salisbury!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Within] An answer from the King, or we will all break in!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O Henry, let me plead for gentle Suffolk!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Whither goes Vaux so fast? What news, I prithee?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I go.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And take my heart with thee.           [She kisses him]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How fares my lord? Speak, Beaufort, to thy sovereign.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Beaufort, it is thy sovereign speaks to thee.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: See how the pangs of death do make him grin

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Disturb him not, let him pass peaceably.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So bad a death argues a monstrous life.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What is my ransom, master, let me know?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A thousand crowns, or else lay down your head.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And so much shall you give, or off goes yours.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll give it, sir: and therefore spare my life.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And so will I, and write home for it straight.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Be not so rash; take ransom, let him live.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The Duke of Suffolk muffled up in rags?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: But Jove was never slain, as thou shalt be.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Speak, Captain, shall I stab the forlorn swain?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: First let my words stab him, as he hath me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Base slave, thy words are blunt, and so art thou.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou dar'st not, for thy own.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Poole!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Poole?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Walter-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come, Suffolk, I must waft thee to thy death.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Gelidus timor occupat artus: it is thee I fear.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My gracious lord, entreat him, speak him fair.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hale him away, and let him talk no more.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come and get thee a sword, though made of a lath; they have been up these two days.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: They have the more need to sleep now, then.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I tell thee Jack Cade the clothier means to dress the commonwealth, and turn it, and set a new nap upon it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So he had need, for 'tis threadbare. Well, I say it was never merry world in England since gentlemen came up.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O miserable age! Virtue is not regarded in handicraftsmen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let me alone. Dost thou use to write thy name, or hast thou a mark to thyself, like a honest plain-dealing man?

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, I thank God, I have been so well brought up that I can write my name.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He hath confess'd. Away with him! He's a villain and a traitor.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where's our General?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here I am, thou particular fellow.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Stand, villain, stand, or I'll fell thee down. He shall be encount'red with a man as good as himself. He is but a knight, is 'a?

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No.

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

Fellow kings, I tell you that that Lord Say hath gelded the commonwealth and made it an eunuch; and more than that, he can speak French, and therefore he is a traitor.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O gross and miserable ignorance!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, no; and therefore we'll have his head.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

He has a familiar under his tongue; he speaks not o' God's name. Go, take him away, I say, and strike off his head presently, and then break into his son-in-law's house, Sir James Cromer, and strike off his head, and bring them both upon two poles hither.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It shall be done.

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Marry, presently.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: God save the King! God save the King!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We'll follow Cade, we'll follow Cade!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A Clifford! a Clifford! We'll follow the King and Clifford.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Was ever feather so lightly blown to and fro as this multitude? The name of Henry the Fifth hales them to an hundred mischiefs, and makes them leave me desolate. I see them lay their heads together to surprise me. My sword make way for me for here is no staying. In despite of the devils and hell, have through the very middest of you! and heavens and honour be witness that no want of resolution in me, but only my followers' base and ignominious treasons, makes me betake me to my heels.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Health and glad tidings to your Majesty!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here's the lord of the soil come to seize me for a stray, for entering his fee-simple without leave. Ah, villain, thou wilt betray me, and get a thousand crowns of the King by carrying my head to him; but I'll make thee eat iron like an ostrich and swallow my sword like a great pin ere thou and I part.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Brave thee? Ay, by the best blood that ever was broach'd, and beard thee too. Look on me well: I have eat no meat these five days, yet come thou and thy five men and if I do not leave you all as dead as a door-nail, I pray God I may never eat grass more.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Iden, farewell; and be proud of thy victory. Tell Kent from me she hath lost her best man, and exhort all the world to be cowards; for I, that never feared any, am vanquished by famine, not by valour.                                        [Dies]

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: York, if thou meanest well I greet thee well.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Upon thine honour, is he prisoner?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Upon mine honour, he is prisoner.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Then what intends these forces thou dost bring?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I was, an't like your Majesty.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How art thou call'd? And what is thy degree?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And here comes Clifford to deny their bail.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will you not, sons?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, noble father, if our words will serve.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And if words will not, then our weapons shall.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, what a brood of traitors have we here!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, we shall heat you thoroughly anon.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Take heed, lest by your heat you burn yourselves.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hast thou not sworn allegiance unto me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A subtle traitor needs no sophister.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Call Buckingham, and bid him arm himself.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The first I warrant thee, if dreams prove true.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Foul stigmatic, that's more than thou canst tell.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Of one or both of us the time is come.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What seest thou in me, York? Why dost thou pause?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Away, my lord! You are slow; for shame, away!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE SECOND PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Can we outrun the heavens? Good Margaret, stay.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE THIRD PART OF KING HENRY THE SIXTH
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I wonder how the King escap'd our hands.
