ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I beseech your honour, vouchsafe me a word; it does concern you near.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Near! Why then, another time I'll hear thee. I prithee let's be provided to show them entertainment.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: May it please vour honour, Lord Lucius, out of his free love, hath presented to you four milk-white horses, trapp'd in silver.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: With more than common thanks I will receive it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, he's the very soul of bounty!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And now I remember, my lord, you gave good words the other day of a bay courser I rode on. 'Tis yours because you lik'd it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, I beseech you pardon me, my lord, in that.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, none so welcome!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, defil'd land, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We are so virtuously bound-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And so am I to you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So infinitely endear'd-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: All to you. Lights, more lights!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The best of happiness, honour, and fortunes, keep with you, Lord Timon!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, I'll nothing; for if I should be brib'd too, there would be none left to rail upon thee, and then thou wouldst sin the faster. Thou giv'st so long, Timon, I fear me thou wilt give away thyself in paper shortly. What needs these feasts, pomps, and vain-glories?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, an you begin to rail on society once, I am sworn not to give regard to you. Farewell; and come with better music.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here, sir; what is your pleasure?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I go, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I will, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good even, Varro. What, you come for money?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is't not your business too?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is. And yours too, Isidore?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would we were all discharg'd!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I fear it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord, here is a note of certain dues.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dues! Whence are you?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Of Athens here, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Go to my steward.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, good my lord-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Contain thyself, good friend.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: One Varro's servant, my good lord-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: From Isidore: he humbly prays your speedy payment-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If you did know, my lord, my master's wants-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Twas due on forfeiture, my lord, six weeks and past.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hang him, he'll abuse us!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A plague upon him, dog!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How dost, fool?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dost dialogue with thy shadow?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I speak not to thee.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, 'tis to thyself. [To the FOOL] Come away.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [To VARRO'S SERVANT] There's the fool hangs on your back already.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, thou stand'st single; th'art not on him yet.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where's the fool now?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He last ask'd the question. Poor rogues and usurers' men! Bawds between gold and want!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What are we, Apemantus?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Asses.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That you ask me what you are, and do not know yourselves. Speak to 'em, fool.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How do you, gentlemen?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Gramercies, good fool. How does your mistress?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: She's e'en setting on water to scald such chickens as you are. Would we could see you at Corinth!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Look you, here comes my mistress' page.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [To the FOOL] Why, how now, Captain? What do you in this wise company? How dost thou, Apemantus?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would I had a rod in my mouth, that I might answer thee profitably!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Prithee, Apemantus, read me the superscription of these letters; I know not which is which.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Canst not read?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: There will little learning die, then, that day thou art hang'd. This is to Lord Timon; this to Alcibiades. Go; thou wast born a bastard, and thou't die a bawd.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will you leave me there?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If Timon stay at home. You three serve three usurers?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay; would they serv'd us!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So would I- as good a trick as ever hangman serv'd thief.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Are you three usurers' men?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, fool.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I think no usurer but has a fool to his servant. My mistress is one, and I am her fool. When men come to borrow of your masters, they approach sadly and go away merry; but they enter my mistress' house merrily and go away sadly. The reason of this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I could render one.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Do it then, that we may account thee a whoremaster and a knave; which notwithstanding, thou shalt be no less esteemed.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What is a whoremaster, fool?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A fool in good clothes, and something like thee. 'Tis a spirit. Sometime 't appears like a lord; sometime like a lawyer; sometime like a philosopher, with two stones moe than's artificial one. He is very often like a knight; and, generally, in all shapes that man goes up and down in from fourscore to thirteen, this spirit walks in.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou art not altogether a fool.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That answer might have become Apemantus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come with me, fool, come.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let all my land be sold.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: To Lacedaemon did my land extend.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You tell me true.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Prithee no more.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Assurance bless your thoughts!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My lord! my lord!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: As you have said, my lord.          Exeunt SERVANTS

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] Lord Lucius and Lucullus? Humh!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is't true? Can't be?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have told my lord of you; he is coming down to you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here's my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: His health is well, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am right glad that his health is well, sir. And what hast thou there under thy cloak, pretty Flaminius?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Faith, nothing but an empty box, sir, which in my lord's behalf I come to entreat your honour to supply;  who, having great and instant occasion to use fifty talents, hath sent to your lordship to furnish him, nothing doubting your present assistance therein.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Please your lordship, here is the wine.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Flaminius, I have noted thee always wise. Here's to thee.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Your lordship speaks your pleasure.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha! Now I see thou art a fool, and fit for thy master.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who, the Lord Timon? He is my very good friend, and an honourable gentleman.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We know him for no less, though we are but strangers to him. But I can tell you one thing, my lord, and which I hear from common rumours: now Lord Timon's happy hours are done and past, and his estate shrinks from him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fie, no: do not believe it; he cannot want for money.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I tell you, denied, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: See, by good hap, yonder's my lord; I have sweat to see his honour.- My honour'd lord!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Servilius? You are kindly met, sir. Fare thee well; commend me to thy honourable virtuous lord, my very exquisite friend.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: May it please your honour, my lord hath sent-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha! What has he sent? I am so much endeared to that lord: he's ever sending. How shall I thank him, think'st thou? And what has he sent now?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Has only sent his present occasion now, my lord, requesting your lordship to supply his instant use with so many talents.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dost thou speak seriously, Servilius?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Upon my soul, 'tis true, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What a wicked beast was I to disfurnish myself against such a good time, when I might ha' shown myself honourable! How unluckily it happ'ned that I should purchase the day before for a little part and undo a great deal of honour! Servilius, now before the gods, I am not able to do- the more beast, I say! I was sending to use Lord Timon myself, these gentlemen can witness; but I would not for the wealth of Athens I had done't now. Commend me bountifully to his good lordship, and I hope his honour will conceive the fairest of me, because I have no power to be kind. And tell him this from me: I count it one of my greatest afflictions, say, that I cannot pleasure such an honourable gentleman. Good Servilius, will you befriend me so far as to use mine own words to him?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, sir, I shall.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Do you observe this, Hostilius?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, too well.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Religion groans at it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well met; good morrow, Titus and Hortensius.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The like to you, kind Varro.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Lucius! What, do we meet together?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And Sir Philotus too!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good day at once.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: welcome, good brother, what do you think the hour?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Labouring for nine.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: So much?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is not my lord seen yet?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Not yet.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I wonder on't; he was wont to shine at seven.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I am of your fear for that.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Most true, he does.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is against my heart.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Yes, mine's three thousand crowns; what's yours?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Five thousand mine.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: One of Lord Timon's men.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Flaminius! Sir, a word. Pray, is my lord ready to come forth?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, indeed, he is not.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We attend his lordship; pray signify so much.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Do you hear, sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: By your leave, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE LIFE OF TIMON OF ATHENS

From heaven! Alas, sir, I never came there. God forbid I should be so bold to press to heaven in my young days. Why, I am going with my pigeons to the Tribunal Plebs, to take up a matter of brawl betwixt my uncle and one of the Emperal's men.
Why, sir, that is as fit as can be to serve for your oration; and let him deliver the pigeons to the Emperor from you.
Tell me, can you deliver an oration to the Emperor with a grace?
Nay, truly, sir, I could never say grace in all my life.
Ay, sir.

Then here is a supplication for you. And when you come to him, at the first approach you must kneel; then kiss his foot; then deliver up your pigeons; and then look for your reward. I'll be at hand, sir; see you do it bravely.
I warrant you, sir; let me alone.

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well! why, so I do.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

I will buy nine sparrows for a penny, and his pia mater is not worth the ninth part of a sparrow. This lord, Achilles, Ajax-who wears his wit in his belly and his guts in his head-I'll tell you what I say of him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, what?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A good riddance.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Farewell. Who shall answer him?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's aught but as 'tis valued?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Within] Cry, Troyans, cry.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What noise, what shriek is this?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: 'Tis our mad sister; I do know her voice.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Within] Cry, Troyans.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Peace, sister, peace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who's there? Thersites! Good Thersites, come in and rail.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If I could 'a rememb'red a gilt counterfeit, thou wouldst not have slipp'd out of my contemplation; but it is no matter; thyself upon thyself! The common curse of mankind, folly and ignorance, be thine in great revenue! Heaven bless thee from a tutor, and discipline come not near thee! Let thy blood be thy direction till thy death. Then if she that lays thee out says thou art a fair corse, I'll be sworn and sworn upon't she never shrouded any but lazars. Amen. Where's Achilles?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, art thou devout? Wast thou in prayer?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, the heavens hear me!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who's there?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thersites, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where, where? O, where? Art thou come? Why, my cheese, my digestion, why hast thou not served thyself in to my table so many meals? Come, what's Agamemnon?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thy knower, Patroclus. Then tell me, Patroclus, what art thou?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou must tell that knowest.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, tell, tell,

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You rascal!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Peace, fool! I have not done.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He is a privileg'd man. Proceed, Thersites.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Agamemnon is a fool; Achilles is a fool; Thersites is a fool; and, as aforesaid, Patroclus is a fool.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Derive this; come.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why am I a fool?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Make that demand of the Creator. It suffices me thou art. Look you, who comes here?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Where is Achilles?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Within his tent; but ill-dispos'd, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I shall say so to him.                              Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What moves Ajax thus to bay at him?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Achilles hath inveigled his fool from him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who, Thersites?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Then will Ajax lack matter, if he have lost his argument

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: All the better; their fraction is more our wish than their faction. But it was a strong composure a fool could disunite!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No Achilles with him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The elephant hath joints, but none for courtesy; his legs are legs for necessity, not for flexure.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I shall, and bring his answer presently.            Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What is he more than another?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No more than what he thinks he is.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No question.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will you subscribe his thought and say he is?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, noble Ajax; you are as strong, as valiant, as wise, no less noble, much more gentle, and altogether more tractable.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why should a man be proud? How doth pride grow? I know not what pride is.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I do hate a proud man as I do hate the engend'ring of toads.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] And yet he loves himself: is't not strange?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Achilles will not to the field to-morrow.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What's his excuse?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] O, this is well! He rubs the vein of him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] And how his silence drinks up this applause!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If I go to him, with my armed fist I'll pash him o'er the face.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, no, you shall not go.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Not for the worth that hangs upon our quarrel.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A paltry, insolent fellow!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] How he describes himself!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Can he not be sociable?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] The raven chides blackness.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll let his humours blood.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] He will be the physician that should be the patient.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: An all men were a my mind-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] Wit would be out of fashion.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] An 'twould, you'd carry half.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Aside] He's not yet through warm. Force him with praises; pour in, pour in; his ambition is dry.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [To AGAMEMNON] My lord, you feed too much on this dislike.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Our noble general, do not do so.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You must prepare to fight without Achilles.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Know the whole world, he is as valiant.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What a vice were it in Ajax now-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If he were proud.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Shall I call you father?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, my good son.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Be rul'd by him, Lord Ajax.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, sir, when he goes before me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You depend upon him, I mean?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, I do depend upon the lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You depend upon a notable gentleman; I must needs praise him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: The lord be praised!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You know me, do you not?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Faith, sir, superficially.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Friend, know me better: I am the Lord Pandarus.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I hope I shall know your honour better.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I do desire it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You are in the state of grace.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I do but partly know, sir; it is music in parts.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Know you the musicians?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Wholly, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who play they to?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: To the hearers, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: At whose pleasure, friend?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: At mine, sir, and theirs that love music.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Command, I mean, friend.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who shall I command, sir?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Friend, we understand not one another: I am to courtly, and thou art too cunning. At whose request do these men play?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who, my cousin, Cressida?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, sir, Helen. Could not you find out that by her attributes?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dear lord, you are full of fair words.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You speak your fair pleasure, sweet queen. Fair prince, here is good broken music.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You have broke it, cousin; and by my life, you shall make it whole again; you shall piece it out with a piece of your performance.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He is full of harmony.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Truly, lady, no.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, sir-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Rude, in sooth; in good sooth, very rude.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well said, my lord. Well, you say so in fits.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I have business to my lord, dear queen. My lord, will you vouchsafe me a word?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, this shall not hedge us out. We'll hear you sing, certainly-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well sweet queen, you are pleasant with me. But, marry, thus, my lord: my dear lord and most esteemed friend, your brother Troilus-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My Lord Pandarus, honey-sweet lord-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Go to, sweet queen, go to-commends himself most affectionately to you-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You shall not bob us out of our melody. If you do, our melancholy upon your head!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sweet queen, sweet queen; that's a sweet queen, i' faith.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And to make a sweet lady sad is a sour offence.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My Lord Pandarus!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What says my sweet queen, my very very sweet queen?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What exploit's in hand? Where sups he to-night?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, but, my lord-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What says my sweet queen?-My cousin will fall out with you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You must not know where he sups.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I'll lay my life, with my disposer Cressida.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well, I'll make's excuse.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I spy.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, this is kindly done.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: My niece is horribly in love with a thing you have, sweet queen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: She shall have it, my lord, if it be not my Lord Paris.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come, come. I'll hear no more of this; I'll sing you a song now.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, ay, prithee now. By my troth, sweet lord, thou hast a fine forehead.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, you may, you may.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Love! Ay, that it shall, i' faith.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, good now, love, love, nothing but love.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: In love, i' faith, to the very tip of the nose.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is this the generation of love: hot blood, hot thoughts, and hot deeds? Why, they are vipers. Is love a generation of vipers? Sweet lord, who's a-field today?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: To a hair.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Farewell, sweet queen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Commend me to your niece.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Have you seen my cousin?

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: She's making her ready, she'll come straight; you must be witty now. She does so blush, and fetches her wind so short, as if she were fray'd with a sprite. I'll fetch her. It is the prettiest villain; she fetches her breath as short as a new-ta'en sparrow.                                                     Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You have bereft me of all words, lady.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Will you walk in, my lord?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O Cressid, how often have I wish'd me thus!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Wish'd, my lord! The gods grant-O my lord!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: More dregs than water, if my fears have eyes.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fears make devils of cherubims; they never see truly.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Blind fear, that seeing reason leads, finds safer footing than blind reason stumbling without fear. To fear the worst oft cures the worse.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O, let my lady apprehend no fear! In all Cupid's pageant there is presented no monster.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nor nothing monstrous neither?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nothing, but our undertakings when we vow to weep seas, live in fire, cat rocks, tame tigers; thinking it harder for our mistress to devise imposition enough than for us to undergo any difficulty imposed. This is the monstruosity in love, lady, that the will is infinite, and the execution confin'd; that the desire is boundless, and the act a slave to limit.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: They say all lovers swear more performance than they are able, and yet reserve an ability that they never perform; vowing more than the perfection of ten, and discharging less than the tenth part of one. They that have the voice of lions and the act of hares, are they not monsters?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, blushing still? Have you not done talking yet?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well, uncle, what folly I commit, I dedicate to you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I thank you for that; if my lord get a boy of you, you'll give him me. Be true to my lord; if he flinch, chide me for it.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You know now your hostages: your uncle's word and my firm faith.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nay, I'll give my word for her too: our kindred, though they be long ere they are wooed, they are constant being won; they are burs, I can tell you; they'll stick where they are thrown.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why was my Cressid then so hard to win?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And shall, albeit sweet music issues thence.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Pretty, i' faith.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Your leave, sweet Cressid!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Leave! An you take leave till to-morrow morning-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Pray you, content you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What offends you, lady?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Sir, mine own company.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You cannot shun yourself.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Well know they what they speak that speak so wisely.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: In that I'll war with you.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Go to, a bargain made; seal it, seal it; I'll be the witness. Here I hold your hand; here my cousin's. If ever you prove false one to another, since I have taken such pains to bring you together, let all pitiful goers- between be call'd to the world's end after my name-call them all Pandars; let all constant men be Troiluses, all false women Cressids, and all brokers between Pandars. Say 'Amen.'

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Amen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Amen.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What wouldst thou of us, Troyan? Make demand.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What says Achilles? Would he aught with us?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would you, my lord, aught with the general?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Nothing, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good day, good day.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How do you? How do you?                              Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, does the cuckold scorn me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now, Patroclus?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good morrow, Ajax.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good morrow.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, and good next day too.                               Exit

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What mean these fellows? Know they not Achilles?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Now, great Thetis' son!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What are you reading?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha! known!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Shall Ajax fight with Hector?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, and perhaps receive much honour by him.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: A wonder!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ajax goes up and down the field asking for himself.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How so?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: He must fight singly to-morrow with Hector, and is so prophetically proud of an heroical cudgelling that he raves in saying nothing.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How can that be?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Thou must be my ambassador to him, Thersites.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who, I? Why, he'll answer nobody; he professes not answering. Speaking is for beggars: he wears his tongue in's arms. I will put on his presence. Let Patroclus make his demands to me, you shall see the pageant of Ajax.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Jove bless great Ajax!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hum!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I come from the worthy Achilles-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Who most humbly desires you to invite Hector to his tent-

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Hum!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And to procure safe conduct from Agamemnon.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Agamemnon!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ay, my lord.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What you say to't?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: God buy you, with all my heart.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Your answer, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: If to-morrow be a fair day, by eleven of the clock it will go one way or other. Howsoever, he shall pay for me ere he has me.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Your answer, sir.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Fare ye well, with all my heart.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why, but he is not in this tune, is he?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: No, but he's out a tune thus. What music will be in him when Hector has knock'd out his brains I know not; but, I am sure, none; unless the fiddler Apollo get his sinews to make catlings on.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Come, thou shalt bear a letter to him straight.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let me carry another to his horse; for that's the more capable creature.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: See, ho! Who is that there?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: It is the Lord Aeneas.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: That's my mind too. Good morrow, Lord Aeneas.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We know each other well.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: We do; and long to know each other worse.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I was sent for to the King; but why, I know not.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good morrow, all.                         Exit with servant

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: You are too bitter to your country-woman.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Dear, trouble not yourself; the morn is cold.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good morrow, then.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: I prithee now, to bed.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Are you aweary of me?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Night hath been too brief.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Within] What's all the doors open here?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha, ha! Alas, poor wretch! a poor capocchia! hast not slept to-night? Would he not, a naughty man, let it sleep? A bugbear take him!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ha! ha!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good morrow, lord, good morrow.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is not Prince Troilus here?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Here! What should he do here?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is he here, say you? It's more than I know, I'll be sworn. For my own part, I came in late. What should he do here?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now! What's the matter?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is it so concluded?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: How now! What's the matter? Who was here?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Ah, ah!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Why sigh you so profoundly? Where's my lord? Gone? Tell me, sweet uncle, what's the matter?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O the gods! What's the matter?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees I beseech you, what's the matter?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: O you immortal gods! I will not go.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: And is it true that I must go from Troy?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: What, and from Troilus too?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Is't possible?

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: [Within] Brother Troilus!

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Let us make ready straight.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

In delivering my son from me, I bury a s: Even she.

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA

ALLS WELL THAT ENDS WELL: THE HISTORY OF TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
